text: The Gorgoderidae are a family of Flatworms (Platyhelminthes). They belong to the ordo Plagiorchiida. The species are parasites of fish, amphibians and reptiles.Libbie Henrietta Hyman: The Invertebrates, Volume 2: Platyhelminthes and Rhynchocoela, the Acoleomate Bilateria. They have distome, which means they got two suckers, one at the mouth (oral) and one at the waist (ventral). == Systematics == There are five genera:Animal Diversity Web * Gorgorodera * Gorgoderina * Phyllodistomum * Probolitrema * Staphylorchis == References == Category:Flatworms Category:Parasites
title: Gorgoderidae
